intro: Chaetogastra muricata, commonly known as the spiny leaf plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, spiny leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a rough, textured surface. The flowers are clustered in panicles and bloom during the rainy season, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds.
